description.narrative:
The Union Cooperative Society in Taunggyi represents the Township Cooperatives in East- and Southern Shan State and has a total member base of 180 Township Cooperatives. UCS itself is member of the apex farmer organisation in Myanmar, Central Cooperative Society. The Cooperative Assessment is a follow-up mission of various introduction- and scoping meetings captured in mission AS.8627 and AS.8775. Agriterra aims to develop a working relationship with two out of the three cooperative layers in East-and Southern Shan State: the Township- and Union level. The main (potential) business activities (will) take place at primary cooperative- and township level cooperatives, while the union cooperatives can play a role in creating an enabling environment and providing services to their township cooperative members.
The current services provided by UCS to its member TCS are related to providing loans, input materials and machinery. The dominant service is the provision of loans from the Chinese EXIM bank. This loan programme will end in 2023. There is a strong awareness in the board of UCS that it needs to further diversify its service offering in order to remain relevant for its TCS members post 2023. The leadership has identified the need to support its TCS members in developing business as an income generating model and to be of value to their respective primary cooperative members. UCS sees most potential in two specific TCS organisations: one aims to produce and sell cooking oil, the other aims to produce and sell coffee. The latter is in-scope for another Agriterra cooperative assessment (AS 8779 CA Ywangan Cooperative Assessment).
There is a willingness to change from the Chairman and in the first collaboration period assessing the responsiveness to change is important, all members of the board and management should be participating in the advisory trajectory. Computerization of accounting system is needed, this would reduce the work load and give more timely reporting and more transparency. Agriterra can offer UCS to help with the change trajectory. The actual ICT provider will have to be a local provider that can implement and give support during and after the project. Recommended is to discuss this with CCS, to make sure that the system is compatible with the system that CCS uses, will use in the future. Develop a business plan together with Ywangan TCS for the coffee processing facility. UCS has financing available, but a good business plan is needed to start with the project
